member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadVirtualizingDataControl.RealizedItemsBufferScale
member.summary: Defines the relative size of the UI virtualization buffers to the height of the viewport. The size of the UI virtualization buffers is defined by multiplicating the height of the viewport by the value defined on this property. If the minimum value of the UI virtualization buffers according to this scale falls below 800 pixels, the value of 800 pixels is used as a value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadVirtualizingDataControl.AsyncBalanceMode
member.summary: Determines how the asynchronous balance is performed. The mode implies that each visual container is realized asynchronously, whereas the implies that the viewport is filled synchronously after which an asynchrounous balance is performed for the rest of the items.

member.summary: No item animations are played.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnNewSource
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate all viewport items using this animaiton when it is initially bound to a data source.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnAdd
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate each new item that is added to the source collection and is realized in the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnRemove
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate each new item that is removed from the source collection and was realized in the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnSourceReset
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate all viewport items out of the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemAnimationMode.PlayAll
member.summary: Animations are played always when the control is bound to a collection, when the source is reset, or when items are added/removed from the source collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataVirtualizationMode
member.summary: Enumerates the different possibilities for data virtualization that can be used in the control.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataVirtualizationMode.None
member.summary: No data virtualization is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataVirtualizationMode.Automatic
member.summary: The data virtualization happens automatically, i.e. the is bound to the control with defined count of the data items and data is loaded by handling the event.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataVirtualizationMode.OnDemandManual
member.summary: The data virtualization happens manually, i.e. the is bound to the control with initial count which is consequently updated when the user requests more data. The event is fired when more data items need to be loaded.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataVirtualizationMode.OnDemandAutomatic
member.summary: The data virtualization happens manually but automatic in terms of user interaction. In this case the event is fired when the user reaches the bottom end of the scrollable list.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.AsyncBalanceMode
member.summary: Defines the different asynchronous balance modes.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.AsyncBalanceMode.Standard
member.summary: Performs a standard async balance operation. In this mode a visual item is realized at once by the UI virtualization logic after which the UI thread is offloaded.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.AsyncBalanceMode.FillViewportFirst
member.summary: The viewport of the control is filled with visual containers synchronously after which an async balance for the rest of the items is performed.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemState
member.summary: Represents the possible item virtualization states.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemState.Recycling
member.summary: The visual item is about to be recycled for further use.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemState.Recycled
member.summary: The visual item has been recycled.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemState.Realizing
member.summary: The visual item is about to be bound to a data item.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ItemState.Realized
member.summary: The visual item has been bound to a data item.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarMode
member.summary: An enumerator describing the possible scrollbar modes for the .

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarMode.Default
member.summary: The default mode: the scrollbar is shown while scrolling and hidden when not scrolling.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarMode.Hidden
member.summary: The scrollbar is never shown.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarMode.AlwaysVisible
member.summary: The scrollbar is always shown.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.NotScrolling
member.summary: No scroll operations are performed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.Scrolling
member.summary: A standard scroll operation is performed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.Flicking
member.summary: A flick-scroll operation is performed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.TopStretch
member.summary: A top-stretch scroll operation is performed. This happens when the upper scroll bound has been reached.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.LeftStretch
member.summary: A left-stretch scroll operation is performed. This happens when the left scroll bound has been reached.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.RightStretch
member.summary: A right-stretch scroll operation is performed. This happens when the right scroll bound has been reached.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.BottomStretch
member.summary: A top-stretch scroll operation is performed. This happens when the lower scroll bound has been reached.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.ForceStopTopBottomScroll
member.summary: A scroll operation is force-stopped and stretch animation is performed in direction top-bottom. This happens when during a flick effect the topmost item is reached and thus the flick must be stopped.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ScrollState.ForceStopBottomTopScroll
member.summary: A scroll operation is force-stopped and stretch animation is performed in direction bottom-top. This happens when during a flick effect the bottommost item is reached and thus the flick must be stopped.
